ygData.subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Enchanters and the Charisma vs Int Battle
ygData.msgSnippet: This is pretty much my experience as well: mid-hundred CHA is almost as good as 200+, but low CHA will get you resisted. I chalk it up to the Vision ...good
ygData.messageBody:
This is pretty much my experience as well: mid-hundred CHA is
almost as good as 200+, but low CHA will get you resisted.

I chalk it up to the 'Vision'...good things don't help much, but
bad ones REALLY hurt! ;)

Kincar Farsighted
Enchanter, Ranger and Shaman of Tallon Zek

----- Original Message -----
From: Larry Madren <smadren@...>
To: <eqenchanters@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, July 28, 2000 12:00 PM
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Enchanters and the Charisma vs Int Battle


> well, and this is from a druids point of view mind you, that cha only
> affects if the spell will stick and (according Verant) from then on the
> charm has to go through a saving roll every so often and that the spell
> caster's stats have nothing to do with the saving roll(duration) on the
> charm. Of course you have to take anything Verant says with a grain of
> salt, so you may want to keep your cha high, but in my exp with my low cha
> halfling(50 cha) if the charm sticks it can last as long as someone with a
> real high cha.
>
> Suttun Fuzziefoot
> Lvl 42 druid of Rocent Nife, obsessed with the crack that is clarity
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
